title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab
OB: No children node is listed when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 2. The newly created data source does not have any database/table/column information. Actual result: When changing the data source for the data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there is no children node listed. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
EB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children nodes should be listed.
SR: Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 2. Go to the data set editor data source page and change the data source. 3. The new data source should have no database/table/column information. Actual result: There should be a children node listed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
